prompt_text:
You are a structured information extraction assistant. Read the following scientific abstract and extract the information into the exact JSON format below. Use only information explicitly stated in the abstract. If a field is not mentioned, use null.

Output format (JSON only, no explanation):
{
  "objective": "string — main goal of the study",
  "method": "string — methodology or approach used",
  "key_result": "string — most important quantitative or qualitative result",
  "model_or_system": "string — name of the model/system proposed (if any)",
  "benchmark": "string — evaluation benchmark or dataset used (if any)"
}
input_text: We introduce LLaMA, a collection of foundation language models ranging from 7B to 65B parameters. We train our models on trillions of tokens, and show that it is possible to train state-of-the-art models using publicly available datasets exclusively, without resorting to proprietary and inaccessible datasets. In particular, LLaMA-13B outperforms GPT-3 (175B) on most benchmarks, and LLaMA-65B is competitive with the best models, Chinchilla-70B and PaLM-540B. We release all our models to the research community.

environment.os_version: Darwin Kernel Version 24.6.0: Wed Nov  5 21:34:00 PST 2025; root:xnu-11417.140.69.705.2~1/RELEASE_ARM64_T8132

affiliation: UTFPR - Universidade Tecnologica Federal do Parana
output_text:
Here is the extracted information in JSON format:

{
  "objective": "show that it is possible to train state-of-the-art models using publicly available datasets exclusively",
  "method": "training language models on trillions of tokens",
  "key_result": "LLaMA-13B outperforms GPT-3 (175B) on most benchmarks",
  "model_or_system": "LLLaMA",
  "benchmark": null
}
